title: Make Qute "No template found for ..." error message more user-friendly

The main issue I have with this is that there is zero indication of which templates _were actually found_ (if any).
With a list of found templates, one could easily see what's wrong.

Another issue comes into play when using constructor injection:
Instead of mentioning `YourClass#foo`, you will only get `YourClass#init<>()` which is not helpful when working with multiple templates.

PS: Also, the trace of this exception is _very_ long, with many causes.

### Implementation ideas

_No response_
